DataElement.preferredDefinition: A unique sequence of characters used to identify, name, or characterize the indexing process that is different from all other UUIDs/GUIDs generated, making it possible to interoperate with data commons and share data within a data ecosystem.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A 128 bit identifier. Depending on the mechanism used to generate it, it is either guaranteed to be different from all other UUIDs/GUIDs generated until 3400 AD or extremely likely to be different. Its relatively small size lends itself well to sorting, ordering, and hashing of all sorts, storing in databases, simple allocation, and ease of programming in general.:A system funded by the National Cancer Institute to explore how varied datasets can be accessed in a secure and scalable manner. DCFS makes it possible to interoperate with data commons and share data within a data ecosystem._A service that provides digital identifiers (ID) for data objects. These IDs can be used to retrieve the data or query the metadata associated with the object.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A 128 bit identifier. Depending on the mechanism used to generate it, it is either guaranteed to be different from all other UUIDs/GUIDs generated until 3400 AD or extremely likely to be different. Its relatively small size lends itself well to sorting, ordering, and hashing of all sorts, storing in databases, simple allocation, and ease of programming in general.

Concepts.definition: A 128 bit identifier. Depending on the mechanism used to generate it, it is either guaranteed to be different from all other UUIDs/GUIDs generated until 3400 AD or extremely likely to be different. Its relatively small size lends itself well to sorting, ordering, and hashing of all sorts, storing in databases, simple allocation, and ease of programming in general.

Property.preferredName: NCI Data Commons Framework Services Indexd
Property.preferredDefinition: A system funded by the National Cancer Institute to explore how varied datasets can be accessed in a secure and scalable manner. DCFS makes it possible to interoperate with data commons and share data within a data ecosystem._A service that provides digital identifiers (ID) for data objects. These IDs can be used to retrieve the data or query the metadata associated with the object.

Concepts.definition: A system funded by the National Cancer Institute to explore how varied datasets can be accessed in a secure and scalable manner. DCFS makes it possible to interoperate with data commons and share data within a data ecosystem.
A service that provides digital identifiers (ID) for data objects. These IDs can be used to retrieve the data or query the metadata associated with the object.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.
